item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, December 7, 2024 at 2:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: Countless.dev – A website to compare every AI model: LLMs, TTSs, STTs (65 points | 15 comments)
2. Every V4 UUID (1098 points | 318 comments)
3. FSharpPacker – compile F# scripts to executables (14 points | 2 comments)
4. Can life emerge around a white dwarf? (43 points | 24 comments)
5. Hiroshi Nagai: Japan's Sun-Drenched Americana (65 points | 10 comments)
6. Next-level frosted glass with backdrop-filter (235 points | 35 comments)
7. The Curse of Recursion: Training on generated data makes models forget (2023) (72 points | 44 comments)
8. Accessing a DRM Framebuffer to display an image (28 points | 4 comments)
9. SpiderBasic (16 points | 13 comments)
10. I algorithmically donated $5000 to Open Source (7 points | 2 comments)
11. PSA: The Kagi search engine directly funds Yandex –- and refuses to stop (19 points | 2 comments)
12. Biggest shell programs (128 points | 57 comments)
13. My second year without a job (284 points | 383 comments)
14. : The Dialog Element (267 points | 114 comments)
15. Lies I was told about collab editing, Part 1: Algorithms for offline editing (207 points | 75 comments)
16. 21 Algol 60 Compilers in 1962 (25 points | 22 comments)
17. OpenAI Reinforcement Fine-Tuning Research Program (180 points | 42 comments)
18. Nucleotide Transformer: building robust foundation models for human genomics (24 points | 2 comments)
19. MultiQueue-Based FPGA Routing: Relaxed A* Priority Ordering-Improved Parallelism [pdf] (24 points | 2 comments)
20. Mistakes as a new manager (201 points | 83 comments)
21. Install postmarketOS on Android phone and use Docker as a home server (258 points | 100 comments)
22. Structured Outputs with Ollama (195 points | 44 comments)
23. DSPy – Programming–not prompting–LMs (143 points | 27 comments)
24. An invisible desktop application that will help you pass technical interviews (79 points | 65 comments)
25. Does Your Code Pass the Turkey Test? (2008) (105 points | 93 comments)
26. RNA-targeting CRISPR reveals that noncoding RNAs are not 'junk' (130 points | 71 comments)
27. Precursors of Copernicus' heliocentric theory (18 points | 4 comments)
28. Romanian court annuls result of presidential election first round (464 points | 949 comments)
29. Debian opens a can of username worms (214 points | 247 comments)
30. Tokyo is set to introduce a four-day workweek for government employees (556 points | 274 comments)
